intro: Euphrasia arctica subsp. minor, commonly known as the Arctic eyebright, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It thrives in cold, rocky, and often nutrient-poor environments, showcasing its adaptability to extreme conditions. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers with prominent yellow spots, typical of the Scrophulariaceae family. Its leaves are usually hairy and arranged in a basal rosette, helping to retain heat and moisture. Euphrasia arctica subsp. minor plays a role in stabilizing soil in its harsh habitat and supports local pollinators.
